channel.title: How to move an object (Altar)
channel.description:
Hey, I have an altar that I want to move because it is right in the middle of the shops, not by the side where I want it to be. What should I change? I looked up the Object ID (6522) and also got the examine text. I then typed the examine text into client.java in the server and i found what I was looking for. I then changed the co-ord of the altar to where I wanted but when I compiled and ran the server it was in the same place! Help!?!?! :confused:
Thanks

item.title: How to move an object (Altar)
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

[quote=“I Yaa I, post:9, topic:299316”]CTRL+F search in client.java: makeGlobalObject under the last one (doesn’t have to be) add

makeGlobalObject(coord, coord, objectID, directionfacing, 10) [/quote]

I just said that…?

Read full topic

item.title: How to move an object (Altar)
item.dc:creator: @I_Yaa_I I Yaa I
item.description:
@I_Yaa_I wrote:

CTRL+F search in client.java: makeGlobalObject under the last one (doesn’t have to be) add

makeGlobalObject(coord, coord, objectID, directionfacing, 10)

item.title: How to move an object (Altar)
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

Dude, your editing the wrong area…

Find something along the lines of makeGlobalObject.

Read full topic

the pic u are showing is wat it does when u click the object not were the item is locate look in ur global objects

item.title: How to move an object (Altar)
item.dc:creator: @PKingKingScape PKingKingScape
item.description:
@PKingKingScape wrote:

Hey guys,
Thanks for all your help, but it doesn’t solve anything. Look at the pic, that is the object I want to move (6522)
The strange thing is, when I search (Control+F) for 6522 in Client.java, it does not find anything in that pic, but when I search ancient magicks, it takes me to this, and this has 6522 in it, but it skips it out when I search for 6522

deqsts.jpg1277×745

Read full topic

item.title: How to move an object (Altar)
item.dc:creator: @King_Lingerz King Lingerz
item.description:
@King_Lingerz wrote:

Epic Ancient:

10 shouldn’t really be changed, since it doesn’t do much.

It does. You just need to know what your doing with it to use it.

Read full topic

item.title: How to move an object (Altar)
item.dc:creator: @Epic_Ancient Epic Ancient
item.description:
@Epic_Ancient wrote:

[quote=“I Yaa I, post:3, topic:299316”]You might have done:

makeGlobalObject(6522, coord, coord, 0, 10);

which really should be:

makeGlobalObject(coord, coord, 6522, 0, 10);[/quote]

makeGlobalObject(coord, coord, objectID, directionfacing, 10)

10 shouldn’t really be changed, since it doesn’t do much.

Read full topic

item.description:
@I_Yaa_I wrote:

You might have done:

makeGlobalObject(6522, coord, coord, 0, 10);

which really should be:

makeGlobalObject(coord, coord, 6522, 0, 10);
